body: Previously, all log messages generated by tox_new (which is quite a lot) were dropped, because client code had no chance to register a logging callback, yet. This change allows setting the log callback from the beginning and removes the ability to unset it. Since the log callback is forever special, since it can't be stateless, we don't necessarily need to treat it uniformly (with `event`). --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/241)

comment_regular_data.body: Ok, makes sense. --- Reviewed 17 of 17 files at r1. Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 2 unresolved discussions. --- _[toxcore/DHT.c, line 797 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/241#-KVsk-TJbwOI6sXwtfcv:-KVsk-TJbwOI6sXwtfcw:b-9i3xqa) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/a4484cf8f963d8a4d3cbf5d1d3db4ec7eef4c7bc/toxcore/DHT.c#L797)):_ > ``` C > > if (!num_found) { > // LOGGER_DEBUG(dht->log, "get_close_nodes(): Assoc_get_close_entries() returned zero nodes"); > ``` Why commented? --- _[toxcore/tox.api.h, line 415 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/241#-KVsjFr_xre3c58za7Cc:-KVsjFrayfLGDdwyuqCP:bs674ae) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/a4484cf8f963d8a4d3cbf5d1d3db4ec7eef4c7bc/toxcore/tox.api.h#L415)):_ > - execution, e.g. by employing appropriate mutex locking. The callback > - registration function must not be called during execution of any other Tox There is no callback registration function anymore, so that sentence should go away. --- _Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/241#-:-KVslUKEOB3-NW3wIZOf:btgupu)_

Review status: 14 of 16 files reviewed at latest revision, 2 unresolved discussions, some commit checks failed. --- _[toxcore/DHT.c, line 797 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/241#-KVsk-TJbwOI6sXwtfcv:-KVtcF_PJBQLOrWTTwQE:bfdbcid) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/a4484cf8f963d8a4d3cbf5d1d3db4ec7eef4c7bc/toxcore/DHT.c#L797)):_
Previously, nurupo wrote… > Why commented? >
> Because it's incredibly spammy. Anyway, this one is going away with #242, so I've uncommented it again. --- _[toxcore/tox.api.h, line 415 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/241#-KVsjFr_xre3c58za7Cc:-KVtcTat-futLPfAURtH:b-896fix) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/a4484cf8f963d8a4d3cbf5d1d3db4ec7eef4c7bc/toxcore/tox.api.h#L415)):_
Previously, nurupo wrote… > > - execution, e.g. by employing appropriate mutex locking. The callback > > - registration function must not be called during execution of any other Tox > > There is no callback registration function anymore, so that sentence should go away. > >
> Done. --- _Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/241)_

I've looked only at the public API and as far as redoing functionality in Rust goes, it doesn't look too horrible, perhaps except for `tox_log_cb *log_callback;` in `Tox_Options`. --- Reviewed 2 of 4 files at r2. commit.message:
Move log callback to options.

Previously, all log messages generated by tox_new (which is quite a lot)
were dropped, because client code had no chance to register a logging
callback, yet. This change allows setting the log callback from the
beginning and removes the ability to unset it.

Since the log callback is forever special, since it can't be stateless,
we don't necessarily need to treat it uniformly (with `event`).

committer iphydf <iphydf@users.noreply.github.com> 1478464509 +0000

Move log callback to options.

Previously, all log messages generated by tox_new (which is quite a lot)
were dropped, because client code had no chance to register a logging
callback, yet. This change allows setting the log callback from the
beginning and removes the ability to unset it.

Since the log callback is forever special, since it can't be stateless,
we don't necessarily need to treat it uniformly (with `event`).
